intro: Cynanchum procumbens, commonly known as the creeping whipsticker, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, hooked fruits that aid in seed dispersal by attaching to animals. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Cynanchum procumbens is valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
